TPC co-chair TPC co-chair TPC co-chair General co-chair Short Bio I am an Associate Professor at the Institute of Informatics of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS) since October/2012. I hold a Ph.D. (2009) degree in Computing from Imperial College London, and I obtained my M.Sc. (2005) and B.Sc. (2002) degrees in Computer Science at UFRGS. Between 2009-2012 I was a Research Associate at Lancaster University, working with security and resilience monitoring in next generation networks. Between 2013-2015 I also held a position of Visiting Researcher at Lancaster University. I am a CNPq-Brazil Research Fellow - PQ2. Projects SMARTNESS - SMART NEtworks and ServiceS for 2030 [2023 - 2033]: Project led by Prof. Christian Rodolfo Esteve Rothenberg (UNICAMP), approved in the FAPESP Call for Proposals for Technological Innovation Programs/CPE/CPA â Engineering Research Centers/Applied Research Centers. Its objective is to develop cutting-edge research in computer networks and digital application services focused on strategic areas. IDRIC - Distributed Intelligence in Communication Networks and the Internet of Things [2024 - 2029]: Project led by Prof. Nelson Luis Saldanha da Fonseca (UNICAMP), approved in the FAPESP and MCTIC Call for Proposals / MCTIC/CGI â Thematic Research Project â Call for Proposals (2022). Its objective is to investigate intelligent solutions for communication networks and IoT based on distributed artificial intelligence. ICoNIoT - Intelligent Communication Networks and the Internet of Things [2024 - 2028]: National Institute of Science, Technology, and Innovation (INCT) coordinated by Prof. Nelson Luis Saldanha da Fonseca (UNICAMP), approved in CNPq Call No. 58/2022, exploring the introduction of intelligence in future communication networks and IoT. RESIST - Resilient In-Network Computing [2024 - 2026]: Project funded by the FAPESP and MCTIC Call for Proposals MCTIC/CGI â Regular Research Project / Call for Proposals (2022), investigating techniques to ensure the resilience of P4 programs in programmable data planes. PROFISSA - Programmable Future Internet for Secure Software Architectures [2021 - 2026]: Project led by Prof. Lisandro Granville (UFRGS), approved in the Scientific and Technological Cooperation Call for Proposals between FAPESP and MCTIC / MCTIC/CGI â Thematic Research Project â Call for Proposals (2019). Its objective is to investigate, map, and advance the use of software engineering techniques when applied to programmable networks. Consistent Composition of Modular Extensions in Programmable Data Planes [2019-2022]: project with funding from FAPERGS Pesquisador GaÃºcho 05/2019 call, investigating techniques for the consistent and efficient composition of P4 programs in programmable data planes. BigCloud - Communications and processing of Big Data in clouds and fogs [2017-2022]: project led by Prof. Nelson Fonseca (UNICAMP), approved in FAPESP/MCTI/MC Strategic Research on the Internet 2015 call, and aims to develop new architectures and mechanisms to provide infrastructures and communications capable of dealing with the evolution of the processing of Big data. Multilevel Resilience in Network Infrastrutures based on SDN and NFV [2017-2020]: project with funding from Universal MCTI/CNPq 01/2016 call, investigating the combined use of SDN and NFV for the development of more flexible, manageable and more resilient infrastructures. P4Sec - Securing Networks in the Programmable Data Plane Era [2017-2019]: cooperation between UC San Diego, CAIDA, and Texas A&M University (USA), and UFRGS, UnB, and UFPE (Brazil), with funding from the National Science Foundation (USA) and RNP (Brazil).
